intro: Iresine hartmanii f. palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's redleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety red foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities. Iresine hartmanii f. palmeri thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
